events.title: Eruption of Mount St. Helens
events.description: Mount St. Helens in Washington state erupted catastrophically causing massive destruction and loss of life.
events.significance: One of the most significant volcanic eruptions in US history with widespread environmental and economic impacts.

events.title: Opening of the First Modern Olympic Games
events.description: The first modern Olympic Games were officially opened in Athens, Greece.
events.significance: Marked the revival of the Olympic Games, leading to the global sporting tradition celebrated every four years.

events.title: First World Science Fiction Convention (Worldcon) Held
events.description: The inaugural World Science Fiction Convention was held in New York City, establishing a major annual event for science fiction fans.
events.significance: Foundational moment for the science fiction community and fandom worldwide.

events.title: Apollo 10 Returns to Earth
events.description: The Apollo 10 spacecraft safely returned to Earth after a successful mission orbiting the Moon as a dress rehearsal for the Apollo 11 landing.
events.significance: Critical precursor mission that helped ensure the success of the first human Moon landing.

events.title: Armenian Earthquake
events.description: A devastating earthquake struck northern Armenia (then part of the Soviet Union), killing tens of thousands and causing widespread destruction.
events.significance: One of the deadliest earthquakes in the late 20th century, highlighting the need for improved disaster preparedness.
